title: Plate, one of twelve
text: It is impossible to be certain if Mary Sumner had a hand in making or engraving this set of plates.  They could have been already completed by her husband William Sumner, a registered plateworker, before he died.  In any case, women in the Sumner family were very involved with the operations of the firm.  Shortly after Mary registered her mark as a widow, she formally entered into partnership with her daughter, Elizabeth Sumner, one of the few women known to enter the trade formally before marriage.
description: One of a set of 12; gadrooned shaped rims, Coat of Arms of Sir Richard King, Admiral of the White
creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Leo A. Hodroff
